item.title: MoPub OpenRTB 2.1 Specification
item.description: Updated August 4,2014 1. Overview MoPub RTB is a way for DSPs and advertisers to bid on each ad impression where the winning bid will pay the second-highest price in the auction. This protocol is largely based on the OpenRTB 2.1 specification. Note that our adaptation may require certain...

item.title: Marketplace Payments
item.description: The revenues and other data displayed in the Marketplace dashboard may be different than the final payment.  There are several reasons for this.  The values shown in the dashboard are based on real-time data feed.  At the end of the processing period, MoPub will look at the actual...

item.title: Marketplace Video
item.description: Video ads offer a valuable opportunity to drive more revenue for your interstitial inventory.  MoPub enables you to automatically introduce video ads from MoPub Marketplace demand partners without burdening your app with additional SDKs. Our video ad support is built to give you the...

item.title: Simple Ads Demo - Android (1/3): Opening in Eclipse
item.description: ​This is the first help article in the 'Simple Ads Demo - Android' series. This series will walk you through the process of setting up MoPub's Simple Ads Demo application on your computer/device as well as guide you through 3rd party (AdMob/Millennial) SDK integration. This will enable...

item.title: Simple Ads Demo - iOS (1/3): Opening in Xcode
item.description: This is the first help article in the 'Simple Ads Demo - iOS' series. This series will walk you through the process of setting up MoPub's Simple Ads Demo application on your computer/device. This will enable you to quickly test various creatives, ad units and network settings in a live...

item.title: How to Create a Direct Native Ads Campaign
item.description: Create an Ad Unit for your native ad   Typically, you will create one Ad Unit per type of ad you’d like to display in an app. For example, if you want to have a banner ad on one screen and a native ad in another, you’d create an Ad Unit for each type. You can create a new “...

item.title: Generating Ad Unit Code for Integration
item.description: From the Ad Unit page, you can pull the ad unit code by clicking “Code Integration”. Once all your ad units have been created, you can follow our technical guide to begin integration of the SDK. Documentation can be found here.

item.title: Reporting
item.description: The MoPub reporting tool can be found here or by clicking ‘Reports’ under Your Account.   Reports can be broken down using up to three different type of paramaters   Please note that data for yesterday becomes available at 12:00PM Pacific Time   You can...

item.title: Integrating 3rd Party Networks
item.description: Please follow links to our GitHub wiki for instructions on integrating third party networks such as AdMob, iAd and Millennial. iOS: https://github.com/mopub/mopub-ios-sdk/wiki#integrating-with-third-party-networks Android: https://github.com/mopub/mopub-android-sdk/wiki#integrating-with-...

item.title: Forecasting for Direct Ads
item.description: Overview of Forecasting MoPub’s Forecasting feature allows you to quickly evaluate available impressions based on the inventory that’s already been booked and sold.  As shown below, Forecasting allows you to visualize available inventory, and see the value of each Guaranteed Line...

item.title: How to Integrate the MoPub Native Ads SDK
item.description: Marketplace Access Publishers who are not approved will not be able to target their ad units at Marketplace and will see the UI below:   To get access to Marketplace, please email nativeads@twitter.com to get your publisher approved. ​Downloading the SDK Publishers can download the SDK...

item.title: Click to Call Line Item
item.description: If you you want an ad to dial a phone number then you will need to format that the click URL as such tel://55555555555. This will call the number when you click on the ad.

item.title: Integer Priority Levels
item.description: Integer Priority Levels enables publishers to assign priority levels to line items in their waterfall independent of the Line Item Type. Line Item Type and Priority are now independent from each other. How are Line Items Prioritized Using Integer Priority Levels? You can now edit the...

item.title: Linking Line Items Directly to In-App Purchases
item.description: To have the click through of ads go to an in-app purchase, you'll need to set up a custom URI scheme. Once you do that, all you have to do is drop the custom URI into the click through URL field of the creative. Additional documentation on how to create a custom URI can be found here.

item.title: MoPub Macros
item.description: MoPub supports the following macros for a publisher’s 3rd party ad tags and trackers:   Click URL (Unescaped):  %%CLICK_URL_UNESC%%    Click URL (Escaped):  %%CLICK_URL_ESC%%   Cache Buster (Generates a random number): %%CACHEBUSTER%%   Ad...

item.title: Progress & Pacing Indicator
item.description: The progress indicator is located inside the pillbox and displays delivery of the entire campaign impression goal   The pacing indicator displays the current pace of the campaign and the expected final delivery for the campaign
